---
title: "Management"
---

This section documents how we organise communication, teaching
administration, research support, infrastructure, procurement, risk
management, and HR.

Use the sidebar on the left to navigate to a specific topic.

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-6}
### Communication

How we communicate internally and externally, including information flows, messaging standards, and points of contact within the lab and the faculty.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Infrastructure

Operational foundations that keep the lab running — financial administration, digital systems, and other enabling resources required in day-to-day work.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Teaching

Administrative and coordination practices related to course delivery and examinations, including collaboration with external instructors and institutional reporting.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Research

Support structures that enable scholarly work, such as publication processes, research travel, and collaboration with the university library and research services.
:::


::: {.g-col-6}
### Risk management

Processes and responsibilities that ensure compliance, safety, and preparedness for critical situations affecting people or operations.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### Procurement

How we obtain the equipment, services, and materials required for our activities, including purchase requests and reimbursement procedures.
:::

::: {.g-col-6}
### HR

People-related processes across the full lifecycle of appointments — from hiring and onboarding to leave management and offboarding.
:::

:::
